result.execSummary:
All charges against Jesse L Noodwang Sr in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesse L Noodwang Sr is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse L Noodwang Sr

records.addlTxt: 8:34 AM Defendant Tony R Noodwang in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter C Lloyd c in court for Tony R Noodwang.  Attorney Austin M Mogard in court for State of Wisconsin.  Officer John Matthews is sworn as witness   Witness testifies to the facts.  Testifies to the search warrant executed and the people involved and present during that search.  Witness identifies the witness and Court recognizes.  Testifies to speaking with Jesse Sr and him telling him who all lived at the home.  Testifies to speaking with some of those residents of the home.  Testifies to substances found in the home and in who's room.  Testifies to tests administered and results of those tests to the substances. Cross examination by Attorney Lloyd.  No questions from attorney Gebert.  Cross examination by Attorney Jakobson.  Testifies to when people were coming and going from the home.  Testifies to what he recalls specifically being told involving people coming and going from the home vs. what is stated in the criminal complaint.  Re direct from the State. Attorney Jakobsen makes an argument to probable cause for Jesse Noodwang Sr. Court questions the State regarding Jesse Noodwang Sr. charges.  Court dismisses 22CF424, Jesse Noodwang Sr.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Jesse L Noodwang Sr in court.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Jesse L Noodwang Sr.  Prosecuting attorney David R. Knaapen in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives time limits.
